Ingredients.1: 8  dried New Mexico chiles, stemmed and broken into small pieces

Ingredients.4: 4 pounds pork shoulder, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes

Directions.1: Place New Mexico chiles in a heat-proof bowl.

Directions.2: Bring chicken broth to a boil in a small saucepan. Pour over the chiles; left soften, about 30 minutes.

Directions.3: Turn on a multi-cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and the select Saute function. Coat pork with flour and add to pot in batches; saute until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

Directions.4: Transfer soaked chiles to a blender. Add broth, garlic, and chipotle peppers; blend until smooth.

Directions.5: Combine blended chile sauce, onion, vinegar, salt, oregano, and cumin in a bowl; pour sauce over the pork.

Directions.6: Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 20 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Directions.7: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove lid.
